info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 06 at 8:28PM CDT until August 09 at 3:34AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.2 feet, State Highway J just east of County Road 206 begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 20.7 feet and holding steady. - Recent Activity...The river rose above flood stage at noon on Thursday, August 4. It has slowly risen since and is near a crest. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest near 21.0 feet Sunday morning. It is then expected to fall to below flood stage late Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Mon Tue Wed Thu Fri Kaskaskia River Vandalia 18.0 20.7 14.0 9.2 8.5 8.2 8.0 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
